attributes.action: Make living wage the same for everyone.
attributes.background:
The living wage should be the same for everyone, no matter the age, gender, race or anything else!

With bill prices rising and many younger individuals having their own houses & cars it's impossible to keep out of debt. 

If your doing the same job, role & hours you should get the same wage

attributes.action: Give photo ID cards to Veterans
attributes.background: I  joined my regular Battalion The Royal Welch Fusiliers. During my time in The RWF I was lucky enough to visit such places as Germany, Cyprus, Central America (Belize) and of course visited Northern Ireland four times ( 1973, 1974, 1075 & 1976)

attributes.action: Dedicate July 1st as a bank holiday in memory of princess Diana.
attributes.background: Princess Diana was a prominent member of British history and deserves to be remembered for her contributions to her charity work and her support of the International Campaign to ban landmines. This bank holiday could replace the Whitsun bank holiday.
attributes.additional_details: The Whitsun bank holiday has become outdated and lost its meaning to the general public. We propose that the Princess Diana bank holiday would be more suitable, as it's closer to the nations heart. Her continued support for Great Ormand Street and other charities has allowed her to become an iconic role model for younger generations to aspire to be like. July 1st marks her birthday and a bank holiday on this day would allow the British public to remember and celebrate her and her achievements.

attributes.action: Headteachers should be aware of what disability a child has in mainstream school
attributes.background: Due to a recent observation through out mainstream schools Head teachers should have the duty of care to know and be aware of the disabilities of special needs chilldren.

attributes.action: Begin phasing out the sale of new fossil-fuel powered cars by 2018
attributes.background: Although by no means the only cause of air pollution, there is an opportunity to make inroads into NOx emissions by the gradual phasing-out of fossil-fuel powered cars, commencing with banning company car fleets from purchasing anything other than fully electric vehicles by 2018.
attributes.additional_details: Then, sales of private non-electric-powered cars must be prohibited by 2025.  Obviously, this must be supported by additional scrappage schemes to help those who must buy cars to meet the additional costs of electric vehicles AND (more importantly), massively increased investment in public transport but by starting with fleets, this will mean the first phase of eliminating fossil fuel powered cars will by carried out by those best placed to absorb the costs - i.e. large businesses

attributes.action: Ban vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes from UK roads except between 8pm & 8am
attributes.background: The UK has a problem with its ageing road infrastructure that simply cannot cope with the volume of traffic that uses it on a daily basis. The volume of road traffic needs to be spread out across a 24 hour period, lorries greater than 7.5 tonnes should only be permitted to travel between 8pm and 8am
attributes.additional_details: The average daily commute has just increased to 2 hours and the general public is being forced to spend wholly unacceptable amounts of time in cars for what are often small journeys. Forcing drivers off the road through increased taxes or toll roads is not the answer. The answer is obvious but the government won't take the action required to tackle the problem. Road traffic needs to be spread out over the 24 hour period and allow vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes to only travel between 8pm - 8am

attributes.action: Remove all American military bases from UK soil.
attributes.background: A relic of the second world war, the UK is littered with underused American military bases, thousands of acres of beautiful UK countryside is being left to waste with no advantage to the UK at all, it's just waste land, not even wildlife is welcome.
attributes.additional_details:
The United States has thousands of acres of UK soil for their own military use which is of very little advantage to us, they provide minimal economic benefits or defence as they are self sufficient and more likely to attract enemies to our shores.
 These bases are generally in prime locations and could be used in countless ways to boost our economy, housing, farming or simply given back to nature to enhance our countryside. American military bases are of no use to the UK, take our country back.

attributes.action: Close Pentonville Prison
attributes.background: This prison is failing both inmates and the general public, and needs to be closed immediately.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/two-prisoners-escape-pentonville-prison-north-london-ministry-justice-a7402701.html

attributes.action: Create a new licencing law for people transporting horses in trailers
attributes.background: Many people have accidents caused by inexperienced drivers traveling with horse box's (trailers) every day, Usually because these people dont have the experience or training to tow such a heavy loads, People trained to drive B+E vehicles (car & trailer) are trained with empty loads not live animals.
attributes.additional_details:
After careful research I have found that for than 25% of road traffic collisions are caused by people towing horse trailers with horses in them. 
83% of the 25% are motorway collisions causeing full shut downs on the M4 28 times this year alone. 
I believe that new licensing laws are needed for these people that wish to transport their horses around. Especially using the motorway to lower the risk of further accidents and also the trauma this must cause the animals.

attributes.action: Increase public awareness and penalties for using mobiles whilst driving.
attributes.background: A mother and three young children were needlessly killed by a lorry driver using his phone recently. A massive  government information campaign is needed to help stamp this thoughtless practice out, also use of existing cameras for prosecutions and an instant twelve month ban for offenders as in DD.

attributes.action: Offer support mentally for citizens dealing with life changing disabilities
attributes.background: For example, many people in the UK suffer with a life limiting/ changing disability. Help as such as how to operate a wheelchair, how to tune cochlear implants etc is provided by the nhs. No help mentally is provided to help people adjust to their new lives.
attributes.additional_details: I know many people including myself who have suffered from a life changing disability. Obviously these disabilites have a major effect on our life and how we see it. Out of everyone i know, not one fraction of us was offered someone to talk to.

attributes.action: Agency workers need to be protected against unfair dismissal by law.
attributes.background: After being let go from an agency working position, I realised that agency workers have little to no rights or protection when it comes to unfair dismissal or even being able to have times off for emergencies (unlike their contracted counterparts).

attributes.action: The mandatory installation of an automatic braking system in all lorries
attributes.background: Due to the recent tragic accidental killing of a family of four people by a lorry with a distracted driver, I petition that all lorries be fitted with an mandatory automatic braking system that would come into force if the driver were incapacitated or distracted.

attributes.action: To allow our Daughter in Law from China to come to UK to meet us
attributes.background:
Our son has been married for four and half years and had to sell up here in the uk to be with his wife as she had two applications turned down once because they did not believe they were married second that she would not return to China.
We are now in our late 80s and would like to meet her soon

attributes.action: Make students learn how to manage money and finance in secondary schools
attributes.background: Students need to learn how to manage their bills and buy food on set budgets. This can greatly improve the standards of young people so that they can go into the world and know what to do with their wage and their savings, instead of wasting money.

attributes.action: Enshrine the UKRI's long-term mission and Haldane principle in Royal Charter
attributes.background: The Higher Education and Research Bill 2016 will dissolve UK Research Councils' Royal Charters and form a super-council, UK Research & Innovation (UKRI), to act strategically across disciplines. The UKRI must aim to fund research for the UK's long-term good, at arm's length from day-to-day politics.
attributes.additional_details: Higher Education and Research Bill 2016 [Bill No 004 of 2016-17]

attributes.action: Legalise the possesion and use of tasers within the security industry.
attributes.background: In the security industry there are certain situations where security staff are unable protect themselves, Innocent bystanders, Assets. Due to individuals being agressive who cant be controlled by using conventional methods or a indavidual with a weapon, Bladed article or a possible firearm etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Each year there is numerous deaths and assaults within the security industry, Which could of been avoided with the use of a taser.

We understand that the use of a taser would be the very last resort. However we believe tasers would prevent such agression just by being a visual deterrent.
Monitoring tasers:
Anyone possesing a taser would need adequate training.
Body cameras to be used in conjuction with tasers to show taser was correctly drawn/used.

Police are the front line but so are we.

attributes.action: Special funding to Councils for social housing for adults with disabilities
attributes.background: Many local authorities have social housing problems... but more so for adults with physical disabilities and/or learning disabilities (who may require shared living). Where housing associations have stepped in to provide properties they charge rents far beyond what is affordable on housing benefit.
attributes.additional_details: Many social housing properties are in disadvantaged areas with high crime, making them unsafe for many adults with learning disabilities, or properties are ill suited for the person's physical disabilities... this results in many people having to continue living wth parents long into adulthood... with complex care needs that place unsustainable pressure on the family relationship increasing the risk of crisis or carer breakdown.

attributes.action: It should be law that the Governor of the Bank of England is a UK Citizen
attributes.background: The UK leads the world in its financial expertise, and there are UK citizens experienced in this field that could do the job, but the position is currently held by a non UK national.

attributes.action: Present a draft UN resolution that would implement a no fly zone over Syria.
attributes.background: UK to call on all civilised nations of the world (via the United Nations) to draft a UN resolution that would implement a no fly zone over Syria and would apply to ALL aircraft of Syria, Russia, and lran for the purposes of military operations until the complete and total cessation of hostilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3000,000 people have now lost their lives in this conflict. The UN has officially declared Aleppo as besieged. Russian and Syrian forces and their allies must not be allowed to continue to flout international law and bomb civilians, civilian infrastructure, hospitals and aid operations. Since the breakdown of the recent cease-fire on September 19 over 500 civilians have been killed in Aleppo alone, with at least 100 of those being children.
Sources: 
www.unicef.org
www.syriahr.com
and more

attributes.action: Make single parents and sole carers a protected category in legislation.
attributes.background: Single parents and sole carers face barriers to employment and social participation beyond those of parents and carers in general. In addition, caring responsibilities are not a recognised 'category' in legislation that protects individuals in vulnerable groups from discrimination and hate crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
Protected category status would prevent exclusion from services and employment by providing a legal right to access, which could be used, to ensure employers and service providers put in place extra adaptations for lone-caring responsibilities, which are a greater barrier than simply parenthood or caring with wider support. This would also enable legal redress against hate-speech often directed at lone parents.

http://tinyurl.com/zh6kkoz
https://gingerbread.org.uk/content/658/Employment

attributes.action: End disability discrimination through Essential Criteria for Driving Licences.
attributes.background: At present, there is no law preventing a role where the primary function is as a driver, or in the Emergency and Armed Services, to be distinct from a role requiring travel, both having an "Essential Criteria" for a "Full UK Driving licence", thus allowing for selective discrimination of disability.
attributes.additional_details:
Roles that require travel such as the following: 
https://roles.mariecurie.org.uk/VacancyInformation.aspx?VId=58439
are discriminating against disabilities whose condition affect their eligibility to drive.
While there are professions, that should be exempt, such as roles where the primary function is driving, or in Emergency and Armed Services roles, we ask parliament for roles outside these selected professions to apply to be able to list a "UK Driving Licence" as an "essential job criteria".

attributes.action: Do not impose the Bedroom Tax on Pensioners
attributes.background: Pensioners have paid Taxes all their working lives now in their latter years with low state Pensions cannot afford to pay an unfair cut in Housing Benefit which is another form of Poll Tax.
attributes.additional_details: The Tory Government is soon to impose the Bedroom Tax on Pensioners by cutting Housing Benefit to OAPS that have extra bedrooms they say people don't use. Some couples need to sleep alone because of different ailments they have so need the extra bedroom, there is not enough Social Housing to rehouse everybody its Social Blackmail which is not Fair on people who have paid Taxes all their working lives and are about to be hit with an unfair Tax in their Twilight Years when they don't need the worry of it all

attributes.action: The Government should send a declaration of Secession to the EU immediately
attributes.background: Britain does not need a Trade Deal with the EU, in fact, it will be detrimental.  Art. 50 will lead us into years of negotiation with little to show for it on their terms.  A trade deal will keep also keep us tied to the EU.  We need to declare WTO rules and offset tariffs with savings.
attributes.additional_details: The EU will continue to argue for a Brexit on their terms when it should be on ours.  The UK voted to completely leave the EU and by following Art. 50, we shall be tied to them for years.  A simple declaration of secession will leave the EU with the option of treating the UK as any other 3rd State instead of trying to hang on to us.  Savings will offset any tariffs they choose to impose, or they can choose to work with us tariff free to mutual benefit and we can trade with the World immediately

attributes.action: make it legal to revoke a step parent adoption
attributes.background:
I have parental responsibility over a child i have no actual connection with.
I feel in the long run the adoption does not benefit the child and could possibly harm them in the future when they are old enough to understand.
The situation i am in is harming my mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
I was in a same sex relationship and adopted my at the time partners child.
We are no longer together and myself and the child have no relationship.
Divorce is an option for married couples with no blood connection, step parents should also have this option when it does not harm the child.

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to sort out the funding for Bisphosphonates for breast cancer.
attributes.background: Thousands of women are potentially missing out on taking these inexpensive drugs because of the lack of national guidance on who should fund them. It is not clear whether the hospital trust, the local clinical commissioning group (CCG) or NHS England central funding should be paying for them.

attributes.action: Government should put a stop to paying of TV licence in the UK!!
attributes.background:
Government should put a stop to paying of tv licence because is not acceptable!
I have lived in spain and other parts of eu country and they don't ask their citizens to pay for TV licence. 
You can make research for yourself.
attributes.additional_details: Most eu countries don't ask for TV licence.

attributes.action: Hinckley power station should be funded by the UK.
attributes.background: The country is asking foreign powers to provide and control our nuclear power. The rates of interest on the money put up is 9% and the guaranteed rate for electricity produced is such that we will suffer  from higher energy prices.
attributes.additional_details: Savers cannot obtain virtually any interest on their savings. They should be offered the opportunity of funding the project secured by the government at a rate of half that demanded by the French and Chinese. This would nevertheless allow them to invest in a project needed by the country but offering them  a reasonable return on their capital.

attributes.action: Ban all non prescription flea treatment for pets in the UK
attributes.background: With 13 million UK households owning a pet, it's common for people to rely on cheap flea treatment. Some non prescription flea treatments do NOT work effectively and will not kill fleas. Studies find that they may, however, kill your pets.
attributes.additional_details:
Not only do these treatments not work but they may actually be dangerous. 

A simple Google search reveals that hundreds of dogs and cats have fallen victim to the ingredients used in cheaper treatments and hundreds have actually died. 

Whilst it's understandably difficult to afford proper flea treatment, this is the price of having a pet and as their owners, we are fully responsible.

Please sign to make any non prescription flea treatment illegal.

attributes.action: Require 30% of all restaurant tips to go towards chefs
attributes.background: The chefs work as hard or maybe even more so it is only fair they get some of the tips. Seeing as most chefs earn a bit less than waiters in most places and work twice as hard at most times.
attributes.additional_details: I have worked in many kitchens where no tips have been cut and have always been unfair and so do many people. I now work in a place where the tips get cut by 40% so that the kitchen has a little extra in their pocket, and it works so great and gives us an extra goal to work towards.

attributes.action: Put a limit on when HGV's and Tractors can access Main Roads and Motorways
attributes.background: During "rush hour" periods 0700-0900 and 1700-1900, HGV's and Tractors should not be allowed on Main Roads or Motorways due to the fact that they make every journey longer.
attributes.additional_details:
A large number of collisions and spillages on roads especially Motorways involve a HGV during busy periods, This leads to severe delays and road closures impacting the remaining 99% of road travellers time at home. 
By limiting the times to which they can travel the rush hour periods should run more smoothly allowing traffic to flow with less accidents

attributes.action: Abolish PMQs and replace with legal requirement to attend select committees.
attributes.background: PMQs no longer serve any useful constitutional purpose. The weekly event has desended into nothing more than political pantomime. Instead to enforce proper democratic accountability the PM should be obliged to attend the Home, foreign and treasury select committee for an hour each per month.

attributes.action: Up the fine for driving using a mobile to six points off license and £500.
attributes.background: Everyday I see dozens of drivers flouting this law and families are wrecked as a result. The present penalties are woefully inadequate and provide very little deterrent.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Poultry Manure being spread on fields for agricultural use.
attributes.background: Over the past several years Poultry Manure has been introduced rather than Cow manure on agricultural land. If the wind is blowing just slightly, then you can't go outside the house without the nauseating and gut-wrenching smell that comes off the Manure.

attributes.action: Provide statistical report of areas / numbers of culled badgers hosting TB.
attributes.background: The Government failed to test culled badgers to measure the percentage hosting tuberculosis & the most affected areas.  This data is key. UK Government ignored advice of Wildlife Experts by continuing the Badger cull. Other wildlife such as Deer host TB, so the badger cull policy is flawed.
attributes.additional_details: Despite all efforts by wildlife experts to stop the badger cull the Government continues with a badly devised scheme to reduce TB.  The most important data was never obtained. Recording the number of affected culled badgers and the areas where TB was most prevalent is surely crucial for developing a strategy to reduce Bovine TB.  A statistical report will show where number of TB hosts are more severe.  Joined up interventions such as vaccinations and bio-security on farms are needed.

attributes.action: Instruct Southern Rail to reinvest all profits until they can run a full service
attributes.background: Southern Rail have been running a minimal and intermittant service while harvesting almost £100m in profit. Many of us will have had sympathy that they were dealing with a difficult situation with engineering work and civil action, however news that they are making such a profit shows otherwise.

attributes.action: Give college/sixth form students loans just like university students
attributes.background: Many people can not attend college sometimes due to not being able to afford things like the bus or metro, and not everybody is eligible for the bursary. However, the bursary is not enough for some people, for example £14 a week can not cover a £20 weekly bus pass.
attributes.additional_details: In addition, many students struggle to buy things such as notebooks and pens and textbooks needed to study. How is it fair that uni students can get loans yet we can't? We would pay it back once we completed studies and got jobs; it's very hard for a 16/17 year old to get a job these days especially without experience. It is very hard to get a job to support ourselves whilst studying a levels- it is simply too stressful which could effect our results and futures.

attributes.action: Introduce Mobile phone jammers into prisons to stop prisoners taunting victims
attributes.background: There has been an increase in prisoners taunting victims, intimidating witnesses and accessing social media. Introducing mobile phone jammers into prisons would rectify this with the flick of a button.
attributes.additional_details: The Secretary of state for justice needs to introduce Mobile phone jammers which would stop all prisoners accessing the internet via smart phones and making calls.

attributes.action: Abolish the wasteful Brexit (Exiting the EU) and International Trade Departments
attributes.background: These departments replicate functions of the existing Foreign and Cabinet Offices and Business Department. They're wasteful and disruptive, serving no useful function. Britain's governing party and its squabbling ministers should settle their differences over Europe internally not at public expense.
attributes.additional_details:
https://twitter.com/lewiscoughlan/status/764377677038030848

http://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/hiring-brexit-experts-will-cost-billions-khn6mw3j2

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/08/13/liam-fox-and-boris-johnson-locked-in-feud-over-who-controls-brit/

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3749965/ANDREW-PIERCE-longer-Theresa-tolerate-three-backstabbing-Brexiteers.html

attributes.action: Charge those who misuse public services through drink or drug abuse.
attributes.background: Charge those who misuse public services, such as the ambulance service, police, fire service or the NHS, through drink or drug abuse. Use the money raised through these charges to improve those services, funding things like cancer research, police on the streets, keep hospitals open.
attributes.additional_details:
An article from The Telegraph in 2015 in reference to the government looking into the cost of obesity, drug abuse and alcoholism to the UK economy.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/health/news/11769531/Cost-of-obesity-drug-abuse-and-alcoholism-to-be-revealed.html

attributes.action: Except for MP salary. 100% tax on all other incomes for UK politicians.
attributes.background: Put 100% tax on all external to post income for all UK politicians including offshore investments and holdings. Prevent income and/or wealth transfers for a year prior to position. Ban a time offset for potential missed outside earnings. Ban employment post role in associated industry for 5 years.
attributes.additional_details:
Except for MP salary. Put 100% tax on all income for all UK politicians including offshore investments and holdings. 

To discourage people from becoming MPs for financial gain.

To encourage future MPs to consider their country the primary reason for taking a political post.

attributes.action: Have a referendum on health and social welfare funding for the next generation.
attributes.background: Health and social welfare funding is a subject very dear to voters but one whose effects run longer than the lives of any Parliament, or the careers of many Civil Servants or politicians.  Whether the UK has a US or Scandinavian model for health and social provision should be subject to plebiscite.
attributes.additional_details: I am a hospital consultant and fellow of the Royal College of Physicians, and feel that this is one of the bigger issues of relevance to people currently, and one which is not adequately exposed or debated within the short lives of Parliaments.

attributes.action: Media exploits individuals in reality shows etc we need a law to protect people
attributes.background: Media exploits individuals in reality shows etc we need a law to protect people. The law must prevent any waiver of liability and subject media companies to strict liability conditions. A special type of warrant must should be available and the ability to subpoena witnesses for the defence.
attributes.additional_details:
Media exploits individuals in reality shows we need a law to protect people, this includes Shilpa Shetty who was subjected to racist abuse on Big Brother, Patrick Dauncey fell from a cliff in The Island, Jacintha Saldanha committed suicide after a telephone prank & Ajwinder Bains in his Truman Show rip-off

All these people have suffered horrific manipulation and it gets worse each year. It is time for Parliament to act, to deal with this increasing problem. There should be high punitive damages

attributes.action: I want a ban on Guns Knives Machetes Swords and other dangerous items.
attributes.background: Guns Knives Machetes Swords are sold openly at Car Boots Sales. We are in a climate where an attack on civilians could happen at any time and in any area. Legislation should be put in place to prevent this practice from continuing.

attributes.action: Stop South Africans voting in UK when Brits can't vote in SA.
attributes.background:
A Brit living in South Africa with permanent residency is prevented from voting in South African elections. However, South Africans can move to the UK and after meeting the residency requirements can vote in all UK elections.
This is grossly unjust and needs to be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Qualifying Commonwealth citizens can vote in all UK elections once they've been resident for the requisite period but in some Commonwealth countries like South Africa there is no reciprocal agreement. This is blatantly unfair and unjust and must be stopped.

Who can vote in a South African election?
http://www.elections.org.za/content/For-Voters/FAQ--Voter-registration/

Who can vote in a UK election?
http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/faq/voting-and-registration/who-is-eligible-to-vote-at-a-uk-general-election

Qualifying Commonwealth citizens: http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/__data/assets/electoral_commission_pdf_file/0009/79515/List-of-eligible-countries.pdf

attributes.action: Compel households to display a sign warning that there is a dog on the premises
attributes.background: Many people may call on a household on a daily basis for legitimate reasons and dog attacks are a significant hazard.  While the number of attacks has fallen after the change in legislation and greater understanding through dog awareness campaigns, it still remains unacceptably high.
attributes.additional_details:
As an example, 2660 postmen/women were attacked by dogs in the last year some leading to a permanent disabling injury. As a postwoman myself I have had a dog bite, which fortunately wasn't serious, but have seen many colleagues that were not so lucky.

A simple sign at the entrance to a property and by the letterbox could help significantly. By making anyone calling at a house aware of the presence of a dog, they can take precautions to ensure their own safety and that of the dog living too.

attributes.action: Cap private rents at Local Housing Allowance (LHA) levels in England
attributes.background: LHAs are not typical of private rents. Those claiming Housing Benefit still have to top up their total rent from other benefits - often an impossible task, leading to rent arrears and crippling poverty. LHAs must be brought into line with actual private rents, or rents capped at the level of LHA.

attributes.action: Call for a Ban on the Industrial Manufacture of Honey in the UK
attributes.background:
Current methods cause massive unnecessary slaughter of Bees. Bees are vital to our survival and to maintaining our delicate eco systems
Unnatural methods used by industrial beekeepers, such as A.I, antibiotics, clipping a Queen Bee's wings are wholly unacceptable
All to satisfy corporate greed
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/GreenWorldTVUK/videos/1623198151304386/?__mref=message

attributes.action: Limit the cost of mandatory insurance policies, i.e. motor insurance.
attributes.background: It is immoral to charge people inflated premiums when it is the law to ensure you have the insurance in place.
attributes.additional_details: Insurance companies use statistics to seperate and ultimately increase charges applied to different parts of the population. More specifically it should be illegal to increase the motor insurance of someone for having an accident which wasn't their fault. If your no claims bonus had increased your premium must drop.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for youth clubs across the UK.
attributes.background: Many people have little awareness about the issues that face young people. Youth clubs support ANYONE in issues they face and help them tackle them but also enjoy themselves. However, there is little awareness, funding or volunteers to help support them so we want the government to increase funding.
attributes.additional_details: The importance of youth clubs go unnoticed, they help thousands of young people get out and meet new people. They relieve built up stress and help with issues that can affect mental health. By raising the funds it allows more young people to be involved in society and make a positive impact towards the community.
